website_summaries.verdict: A great choice for a drying rack if you want excellent portability or have limited space.
pros: Consumers like the fact that this drying rack has no assembly required, and that it is durable yet compact
It stands out for its ability to fold smoothly and be easily stored away even in areas with limited space
cons: Although it's good for small spaces, a few felt the rack was too small, so those looking for more drying area might choose a larger unit
Some also had issues with rust

customer_reviews.title: Great purchace!!
customer_reviews.text: It is sturdier than I thought it would be! Love that its compact and so easy to use! I only have a laundry closet, not room so I need something I can bring out when I need to and not a installed rack. But I am finding I can use it for more than just drying clothes. It works great for this, but love that I can take it outside on days my kids play in water and it will hold their towels and dry them between uses. Used it in a garage sale to display a bunch of blankets. You get the idea!
customer_reviews.author: Swensgirl

customer_reviews.title: Great while it lasted..
customer_reviews.text: Edit: customer service sent me a replacement and it’s lasted almost 2 years now. It’s still not the sturdiest but it fulfills it’s purpose so I’d repurchase due to the great customer service if I found it on sale and needed a replacement. — I’ve been using this rack to dry my sweaters for 2 months and it already has broken. The plastic where it hooks on at the top snapper off. It worked great while it lasted but it’s definitely not the quality product I thought I was purchasing. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous!

customer_reviews.title: Light, Sturdy and Durable
customer_reviews.text: Packed well using two boxes to protect it in shipping. It is nicely finished, light but sturdy looking and the clasp that holds it opened out for use is simple but effective. I had a wood version of this sort of rack and the constant exposure to moisture caused the wood dowels to warp so badly that it could no longer be used. That is why I chose to spend a little more on this metal version. This looks like someone spent that little extra time and thought in designing this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Suds

customer_reviews.title: So far ( several months) I have been very happy with the ease of use
customer_reviews.text: This is the larger version of the folding rack. I use it constantly to dry yoga clothes and towels on my verandah. I weigh it down with a couple of sandbags, because on a gusty day, it can be light enough to get blown about. So far ( several months) I have been very happy with the ease of use, practicality of design, and drying area, hence the five stars. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Read'nRite

customer_reviews.title: Well built, sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Built very well, it's sturdy but it's smaller then I expected. I'm used to the wider wooden racks. Overall I'm pleased with my purchase, though I may need to buy a second one to meet my drying needs.
customer_reviews.author: Traci

customer_reviews.title: I love this heavy-duty drying rack.
customer_reviews.text: This rack is no assembly required and is very light but sturdy enough. For the price, I really think this is the best drying rack out there. Overall, I'm happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Wei

customer_reviews.title: side rails come loose poor pin setup
customer_reviews.text: Lasted two months pins come out of plastic on side bars find a different one
customer_reviews.author: catpond

customer_reviews.title: Great, sturdy, good-size rack
customer_reviews.text: Just the right size to fit in an oversize 100-year-old bathtub, and it holds wet clothing, and microfiber and Japanese towels (tenugui) well. My husband has for several years daily used a smaller version in another bathroom, but I needed a larger rack for my hand washables and fabrics where the color runs. Folds up easily and is stored on its side between the sink and bathtub.
customer_reviews.author: twigs

customer_reviews.title: good metal clothes rack, just the right size for a small area.
customer_reviews.text: I had a large wood clothes rack that was just too large, not being used as much, & taking up too much space in my laundry room. This metal rack is just the right size. Because of the top bars being horizontal you can open pieces up and lay them across 2 bars for quicker more thorough drying. Glad that I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Great Product.
customer_reviews.text: This product is great. It holds the large pieces with plenty of room to dry them. It also holds plenty of small clothes. I particularly love how easy it is to use. The size is perfect for an apartment or great to use for clothes that you do not want to put in the dryer. I definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: TravelLady

customer_reviews.title: Total trash- waste of money- don't buy it.
customer_reviews.text: This has completely fallen apart. Not only have the screws come loose and can't be tightened, but where the screws should attach has come apart on multiple parts, and it's completely trash and unusable. This is a terribly made product. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: jake nelson

customer_reviews.title: Its an ok drying rack.
customer_reviews.text: I'm really not sure how this gets 5 stars. Its very light weight therefore easy to knock over and disassemble while trying to hang items. It is small if you need one of a small size but has a good amount of rack space. It would have been better if it had a weighted base. Since it says its rated for outdoor use as well, we use it to hang our towels and swim suits. While it does hold the items fine, any kind of moderate breeze tends to knock it over especially if you are drying lighter items like pillow cases, swim suits, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Gaelach Aingeal

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Our daughter lives in an apartment in Chicago and has a small hand operated laundry washer to get her and her roommate through till they have to go to the laundromat. They love it as it is space saving and eco-friendly!
customer_reviews.author: Big Reader

customer_reviews.title: Small rack to dry items such as washcloths.
customer_reviews.text: This is a small rack. It's perfect for what I needed it for which was to hang washcloths and other small items to dry. I don't like to keep wet things in the laundry so I use this until I'm ready to actually wash a load of clothes. If you are looking for something to hang a significant number of things on that is very sturdy, try: Large Wooden Clothes Drying Rack by Benson Wood Products which I also purchased and use when I want to dry towels and larger items, see:
customer_reviews.author: Jane in Atlanta

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy! Rack stands up to Ocean Breeze!
customer_reviews.text: This laundry rack is very sturdy and has a nice weight to it. Important quality for me as I live at the beach & like to place the drying rack on the back deck of the house in the sun for the clothes to dry. Prior drying racks would easily get blown over with the breeze off the ocean. This drying rack maintains its stance. Yippie! I did not give it five stars because - I just wish the drying rack was wider. It is really on the petite side.
customer_reviews.author: KItKat

customer_reviews.title: 2 arms arrived broken and bent
customer_reviews.text: Product was packaged very well. Double boxed, however 2 arms were bent at a 30' angle. Probably worth price and free shipping, but not super functional.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Conveniently Folds Up
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because I wanted something that would easily fold up to store in my closet in between uses. It unfolds easily and quickly and is sturdy enough for several sweaters to dry on it. I've had it for about 2 months, use it weekly, and see no signs of damage from wet clothes.
customer_reviews.author: SweetStar687

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Material
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money. Very cheap material. Falling apart after one month.
customer_reviews.author: Ali Chowdhury

customer_reviews.title: Damaged product but will keep it
customer_reviews.text: Product came with the top bar bent. We can still use it because we really need it now that we're staying at home 24/7 but rather disappointed. It's good to hang light laundry, shirts underwear, etc. It's the right size to use in the tub. It's not that sturdy, and if it's used outdoors, the legs need to be anchored somehow. I intend to tie the legs to used milk containers filled with water. However it should not be used if windy...
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Madrigal

customer_reviews.title: Folding clothes dryer
customer_reviews.text: After checking all of the reviews for various clothes dryers this one seemed to be the perfect size and it's exactly what I was looking for, good quality, sturdy & perfect for my large bulky items such as dog bed covers, sweaters, beach towels, etc.
customer_reviews.author: K. Coco

customer_reviews.title: Meh....
customer_reviews.text: Cheaply made and wobbly. I bought this as a temporary solution after my laundry line broke. Its only advantage is that it is slightly wider than most of the other similar racks on offer.
customer_reviews.author: Liz M

customer_reviews.title: Durable, easy to assemble and disassemble.
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about this rack except it’s small. It was very easy to put together right out of the box and easy to fold up and put away. I have a three and six year old and I can barely get two shirts on a row. It works well for what it does hold. When I started looking at others they all were very similar size.
customer_reviews.author: Jakell

customer_reviews.title: I feel like Snow White
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the stay at home order, so I could do laundry at home and not risk the laundromat. And I must say that I should have bought this years ago! Not only is it sturdy and convenient, whenever I put it out, the neighborhood robins come and visit me. Now if only they could help me with the actual washing..... ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth McGhee

customer_reviews.title: Ideal drying rack
customer_reviews.text: I needed a drying rack that would store in a space that would not fit the larger racks. I took a chance on this one, not sure if it would work for me. Much to my surprise, it was even better than I had anticipated. It fit perfectly, yet was still plenty large enough for all my laundry needs. The rack is made of sturdy steel, can be easily folded and will last for many, many years.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: A great buy at any price, but fabulous buy at the selling price
customer_reviews.text: What a little gem this is. I looked at a lot of towel holders to find the right one for pool towels and wet bathing suits. Took a chance on this one b/c it was so affordable and it was a good gamble. It's all assembled and all you have to do is open it up. Lightweight, but sturdy and functional. In two minutes was covered with multiple towels and wet swimming suits that had been strewn around the pool and patio. A great buy at any price.
customer_reviews.author: Animal lover

customer_reviews.title: Love it!! Look no further, this drying rack is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I looked on Amazon for so long to find the right drying rack, I am SO glad I went with this one! It’s sturdy, easily folds up and sets up, compact for storage and gives plenty of space to hang cloth diapers, shirts, nursing covers, etc. No rusting, no problems, I love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Jordyn Sabin

customer_reviews.title: Not well constructed
customer_reviews.text: This looked and sounded (based on reviews) like a decent, sturdy drying rack, so I ordered two. Besides the fact that this rack is not very long, both racks I received were significantly warped. The top didn't lie flat on either one, and the whole structure on each one appeared considerably twisted. I returned both.
customer_reviews.author: Longtime Amazon Fan

customer_reviews.title: No complaints; as described
customer_reviews.text: Been using this for a few weeks now. No complaints, works as described. Folds up smoothly - doesn't crash to the ground or get sticky joints. Smaller than I expected once folded, which is a great plus. Fits a lot of clothes and towels. Very light but sturdy. Construction has a nice smooth feel - sometimes good and sometimes bad, like when I have something that keeps sliding off. I fix that by pinning some things on. Downside is that if I store this folded somewhere on tile where it could fall over, it's really loud once it hits the ground. Startled the dog and roommates pretty bad a few times.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Good investment!
customer_reviews.text: This drying rack is somewhat narrower than a similar one that I purchased years ago from K-Mart (Martha Stewart line of Household products). I actually can live with that because it is space-saving. This featured rack from Amazon can fit it into a corner of the house where my old one would not squeeze in due to its width. It is very sturdy and stable. I had my old stainless steel rack for years and it still handles constant use. I have no doubt that this one will protect your favorite items with natural air drying and save you hundreds of dollars in dryer costs and/or electricity for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: C. French

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a minute now, at least a year and two rails have come apart. Not a lot of abuse/use cause it's just me and I wash small loads once and sometime twice a month...light loads.
customer_reviews.author: Big Mama

customer_reviews.title: wobble no more!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great rack. It holds my blue jeans without bending or swaying. It has plenty of room for knit shirts, too. Overall, it was exactly what I was looking for. I love the white finish. It blends with our woodwork and just looks nicer.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy A.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy. Can handle a lot of drying.
customer_reviews.text: It's sturdier and better made than I anticipated. There are no metal parts to rust, the hinging works well, and the corners and feet all have black plastic ends to protect it from scraping the floor and clothes from snagging. It handles the length and weight of our clothes easily.
customer_reviews.author: Oliveoyl

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! I normally hang my clothes all over the kitchen and dining room table/ chairs and now I don’t have to! It’s easy to fold and unfold. It is a little wobbly, but nothing major because it functions perfectly. I love that I can hang my clothes on it and it does NOT leave a crease in them, once they are dry. I can also get a good bit of clothes on it to dry. I recommend it for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews and ended up buying this drying rack. I am very pleased with it. It snaps together easiy and is stable.I can carry it opened up unto the deck and back inside loaded with clothes without risk of it collapsing. I like the number of bars, including the middle pieces. It has a remarkable amount of space for drying with a small footprint. It collapses for easy storage behind a door.
customer_reviews.author: sue

customer_reviews.title: Loads of drying space!
customer_reviews.text: Great oversized drying rack - very sturdy and that little bit of extra length from side to side makes all the difference! Very pleased with it!
customer_reviews.author: Just my two cents ...

customer_reviews.title: Folding clothes dryer better than Mom's!!
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, easy to set up. Holds a small load of delicates or a bunch of t-shirts or a couple or three pair of jeans. After throwing away several wooden ones I had given up looking to replace the folding dryer of the 80's until I found this one. Nice stainless bars with no rough areas. I am in love!!
customer_reviews.author: SCNana

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: Too small. The picture is misleading. You can hand only one shirt lengthwise in this and that's how many this can hold. The previous ones that I had could hold more than 1 shirt length wise.
customer_reviews.author: OclaOruid

customer_reviews.title: Small but clean and good looking
customer_reviews.text: For some things we don't put in the dryer, this rack is very useful. While a bit small, it's sturdy and we love the metal vs. wood rack look and feel.
customer_reviews.author: Steve S

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting
customer_reviews.text: I've had this rack for a few years now and it still works great! It holds a lot and takes up little space in my apartment. I usually load it up with heavy wet sweaters and slacks and it never falls over.
customer_reviews.author: Nisy

customer_reviews.title: Compact but has a lot of drying space
customer_reviews.text: This really works for my intended use which is drying socks and delicates. It's small enough to stay in small laundry room thats used as walk-through from garage. The smooth grey bars give it clean look and folds nicely when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: JOS

customer_reviews.title: made of metal + sturdy
customer_reviews.text: It's well made + much more sturdy than the plastic one I had. It folds easily + is easy to reassemble as needed. I use for clothes that didn't quite dry in the dryer & I got tired of waiting in the laundry room. I live the water, no mold, no rust. Take my heavy white Thorlos socks out of the washer [among other things]+ dry them on the rack.
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine L.

customer_reviews.title: Would not hold a full load but a nice product I am happy to have purchased
customer_reviews.text: Compact but holds at least six T-shirts. Probably more if I worked at it. I live full time in an RV and space is important. I hang until damp dry then on normal hangers to finish. Would not hold a full load but a nice product I am happy to have purchased. Also a nice feature is it requires no assembly.
customer_reviews.author: William Schiffbauer

customer_reviews.title: Description of my use of the Storage Maniac Clothes Drying Rack
customer_reviews.text: I use this clothes drying rack to hang my washed clothes to dry in my hotel room in Accra, Ghana. I purchased my original clothes drying rack last year and used it every day during my 2 month stay in Ghana. I gave my original clothes drying rack to my friend and his family to use and now brought a replacement to take with me in my suitcase (the folded rack fits in a large suit case) to take with me when I again travel to Ghana later this year. Thank you for offering a durable and very useful travel product.
customer_reviews.author: Jean Naples

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I was happily surprised at the quality of this rack. Absolutely love it and even better I didn’t have to assemble it!!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Nice drying rack.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice metallic drying rack. I wobbles a bit but I have never met a drying rack that did not. Actually, I find it sturdier than most. No signs of rust or other problems. Perfect for my small laundry closet.
customer_reviews.author: P. Radcliffe

customer_reviews.title: It's like half of the regular width of a standard stand
customer_reviews.text: It's much, much more narrow than pictured. It's like half of the regular width of a standard stand. It's supposed to be really well made but it's not. The parts pop apart and fall off all the time. I have to stick them back together in order for the unit to work.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan A. Spencer

customer_reviews.title: It holds up nicely with two pairs of jeans or dress pants on ...
customer_reviews.text: It holds up nicely with two pairs of jeans or dress pants on top and a few lightweight pairs of workout pants/leggings below at a time. I wouldn't drape an entire load of laundry on this at once, unless it was all small, delicate pieces, but it does exactly what I wanted it to do - hold jeans and dress pants so they dry without oddly placed wrinkles. I use it on a weekly basis since I got it a month or two ago and it has been worth the money so far.
customer_reviews.author: Steph L.

customer_reviews.title: Either quality control missed a problem or something happened during shipment...
customer_reviews.text: When this drying rack arrived at my house one of the rods near the bottom of the rack was bent. It’s no big deal since it’s near the bottom, but a little more care in handling would have been appreciated. Otherwise, it’s sturdy, easy to set up, and has plenty of room for hanging clothes.
customer_reviews.author: J Slaughter

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: I have had several wooden drying racks over the years., I really like this metal rack. It is very sturdy and compact. It feels like it will last for years. I wanted a slightly smaller model than the wooden racks I have and have had. This does the job very well. Very pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Chesbay

customer_reviews.title: I love it! It fits perfectly under a small space ...
customer_reviews.text: My wooden drying rack broke after years of use, so I ordered this one. I love it! It fits perfectly under a small space that I have in my laundry room under the stairs. Enough room on it for all my non dryable pants and lingerie. I would order this again!
customer_reviews.author: Carole Bishop

customer_reviews.title: Decent simple drying rack
customer_reviews.text: Pretty solid drying rack. It's held up for all my drying needs thus far. It does seem a little flimsy and may break down over time. It's amazing how little of drying space you actually after you start to load it up. But I'd rather keep it this smaller size than have a giant rack to find room for.
customer_reviews.author: NC86

customer_reviews.title: So I set this up in front of the fireplace and everything hung securely and dried nicely. It's steady and fairly sturdy (was pla
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes I just don't want to start the dryer for a few wet things from shoveling snow. So I set this up in front of the fireplace and everything hung securely and dried nicely. It's steady and fairly sturdy (was placed on a brick hearth). I like that it's metal and sets up & collapses quickly. Easy to set up even for an elder with arthritis (mother-in-law). Folds up to about 4 inches and stores easily. Totally recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Bostonian

customer_reviews.title: This is a perfect replacement for my clothesline if I only have a ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect replacement for my clothesline if I only have a few things to dry. I used it today, and as I did I was thinking how handly it is. It folds easily and stays in my laundry room when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Cookster

customer_reviews.title: yet sturdy, this is drying rack folds into a compact ...
customer_reviews.text: Light-weight, yet sturdy, this is drying rack folds into a compact unit that is easy to store in a small space. It sets up quickly and will accommodate all the clothes I want to air dry, or those still damp from the dryer. Very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: In good condition I’m sure the rack is sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: When package arrived it was in good condition. The rack itself, inside the shrink wrap, had two of the rails bent so that the rack was unbalanced when we set it up. We were able to manually bend them back enough to be ok.
customer_reviews.author: Marti C.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with my drying rack. It is sturdy and can be collapsed to fit right next to my washer; it does not take up extra space. I was a little apprehensive that the metal would rust when I put wet clothes on it but that is not the case. It is perfect for the items I don't want to put in the dryer and can be placed out of site when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Jean Smith

customer_reviews.title: Quality is not terrible but not the best
customer_reviews.text: 5 stars seemed too high but 4 seemed too nitpicky. Construction quality is not top of the line. One of my top beams is hard to lock in place and scratches the metal. I'm actually debating returning it because I don't know how this will hold up long term.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: It’s decent.
customer_reviews.text: Decent laundry rack. It has started leaning to one side which is why I knocked one star off. I don’t feel like I’m overloading it so I’m not sure why it’s leaning. Overall good for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Kalie

customer_reviews.title: Love that it's compact and so easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Love that it's compact and so easy to use! I don't have a laundry room, I just have a laundry closet, so I needed something I can pull out to hang up my clothes on, and this is PERFECT! The surface is smooth with no rough edges to catch fine garments. I also use it outside to hang up my daughter's swim stuff! It is so convenient and lightweight! It is very sturdy and it holds a lot at once! I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Tim & Krista

customer_reviews.title: It can be easily fold and kept in storage room when not needed
customer_reviews.text: this is very stable drying rack. The material is very well built. It can be easily fold and kept in storage room when not needed. I bought this to replace my old drying rack, which​ is plastic, and i think it is well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: RD

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I live in a small room with a shared bathroom, and like to air-dry my tank tops and underwear to prevent shrinkage and wear. It's so compact that I don't remember that I have it until I need it. I bought it on a lightening deal , though not THAT much cheaper than regular price. I would have paid full price for it even though my wallet would cry a little (college student here), since I want a product that lasts.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk. Nightmare from the first day we had it
customer_reviews.text: Garbage. Don’t waste your money. Falls apart each time I use it.
customer_reviews.author: Spellchecker

customer_reviews.title: Great drying rack
customer_reviews.text: Excellent drying rack for price. Well made and folds up nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Vodka Gimlet

customer_reviews.title: Seems like it will be very durable
customer_reviews.text: Just as described! Seems like it will be very durable, and easily folds away for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: It's well made but not really wide
customer_reviews.text: I should have paid attention to the width. My fault. Each rack is big enough to hold one shirt, but not always wide enough to spread the shirt out. It is sturdy and well made.
customer_reviews.author: RB

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what it should.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy. I needed a dryer that would fit a narrow space, and this one was perfect. It is exactly as it is described, and has held up with several sweaters laying over it on a weekly basis (cold climate). Easy to set up, easy to fold up, collapses nicely to store away when not needed. The only improvement I would make is some sort of locking mechanism when it is fully extended.
customer_reviews.author: J. Downey

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, one piece unit
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd one I have purchased. First 2 work perfectly and I love that they are one unit and not falling apart like some Clothesbars do. This last one however, is twisted or racked somehow and it just will not stand up evenly otherwise I would have given 5 stars across the board.
customer_reviews.author: Terry S.

customer_reviews.title: Strong, yet light weight rack
customer_reviews.text: We bought this drying rack for use with our camping trailer. The size was perfect for this, and the metal construction and finish should hold up well in an outdoor application. The size is adequate for towels. The setup is simple. We are very happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: PA retired dude

customer_reviews.title: Compact  steel folding clothes rack
customer_reviews.text: Perfect perfect perfect I ordered this to replace my centuries old wooden one that broke .....what a great purchase money well spent . This rack is very sturdy and compact but seems to fit just as many clothes as my larger wooden rack. Definelty recommend this rack will never break and much more compact than the older wooden models . I use it every week and have had it for about I year now LOVE IT
customer_reviews.author: Tamara Baker Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Useful!
customer_reviews.text: When I opened the package, I never thought the rack was such a big one. The value of this is far more than the price. Also, it is stable. You could use it to dry your towels, underwear and some clothes in small size. You just need to stretch it and there are two grooves for clamping.
customer_reviews.author: Janine

customer_reviews.title: Good rack but not sufficiently wide
customer_reviews.text: This is a well-built rack, light and easy to use. I gave only 4 stars because it is too narrow to dry a shirt or large towel.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Comes assembled. Takes all of five seconds to set up; hasn’t buckled under laundry. I leave it open so not sure of wear and tear w folding/unfolding.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Masterson

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but smaller than expected
customer_reviews.text: While this is a sturdy item it is very small... my expectations were that this would be double the width. We had to buy two and it unfortunately doesn’t work as well as having one larger rack.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So easy to fold-unfold!
customer_reviews.text: Love this rack. I am ordering another one. It’s very easy to put away after use.
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Junk
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money on this flimsy drying rack. Got it in May and has already fallen apart ..
customer_reviews.author: S. Forrester

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful drying rack!
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful drying rack! It is holding up all of my hand washed clothes nicely including the towels I dried the clothes with! Great product! No rust as of yet, but I will update my review if that ever happens to change.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Great drying rack
customer_reviews.text: Easy to fold/unfold and sturdy for drying a lot of laundry.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as pictured and description was accurate
customer_reviews.text: I keep in a spare bathroom to drip some delicate items on.
customer_reviews.author: Madeline

customer_reviews.title: Good sized and durable
customer_reviews.text: This rack suits my purpose for items that need to be lined dry. It is sturdy and has held up well with constant use. It is a good size, but it seems I can always use just a little more space.
customer_reviews.author: NightShiftRN

customer_reviews.title: Durable but very small
customer_reviews.text: It's durable but very small. I gave it away because it didn't work for our family. I would recommend it be used for children's clothes.
customer_reviews.author: Kim D

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product.
customer_reviews.text: I recommend this product to anyone who needs a clothes drying rack. It's light weight and stable. I put it in my bathtub when I use it. I highly recommend the product.
customer_reviews.author: The Skeptic

customer_reviews.title: OK item, just to narrow.
customer_reviews.text: A little disappointed in the size, it is narrower then I expected. Doesn't hold Beach towels well. My mistake for not reading the description more.
customer_reviews.author: trynlady

customer_reviews.title: very sturdy drying rack
customer_reviews.text: This is a very well made, very sturdy drying rack. I have had several of the wooden racks in the past, and none of them ever stayed together, and eventually the wood gets ruined from the wet clothes. This one can be picked up and moved without it coming apart, and because it is made of steel, water damage is not an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. C

customer_reviews.title: Terrific
customer_reviews.text: Excellent drying rack - Very Pleased! Plenty of room for my clothes - they are now drying faster than when hanging in the tub. Fast, instant setup - no assembly. Stores flat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: After just a month or so of use, the cheap metal coating started coming off on to my clothing. VERY cheap manufacturing. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So convenient
customer_reviews.text: Used the product to hold clothes from the washer as I have no dryer.
customer_reviews.author: MissyD

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THE QUALITY AND A SMALL SPACE ITS TAKE WHEN ...
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THE QUALITY AND A SMALL SPACE ITS TAKE WHEN ITS CLOSED. THE ONLY COMPLAIN IS THAT THE FIRST LEVEL IS TOO LOW, ITS MEAN TOO CLOSE TO THE FLOOR, SO THE CLOTHES COULD TOUCH THE FLOOR,IF YOU ARE NOT CAREFULL AND FOLD THEM IN TWO . . I WISH IT WAS 5 INCHES TALLER ALL THE RACK, SO EACH LEVEL WOULD BE 5 INCHES TALLER. BUT I LIKE IT A LOT .
customer_reviews.author: Susan b.

customer_reviews.title: Good deal and strong.
customer_reviews.text: Great little unit.. I wanted something strong and smaller for a condo. Fits in my closet without any problems.
customer_reviews.author: rcataldo

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy and broke after a few uses
customer_reviews.text: I used this product to hang a few t shirts and a pair of jeans and it buckled and broke after a few uses. It was also pretty unstable before it broke and essentially a waste of money. I would avoid this product.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Keegan

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy rack
customer_reviews.text: Folding rack is usually not strong and sturdy, but this one surprised me. I found this rack is pretty strong and stable even after I put several towels. If you don't use it, just fold it and put it in a corner to save space. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: Not so sturdy but can carr6 and keep it anywhere
customer_reviews.text: Works for me. Not so sturdy but can carr6 and keep it anywhere. Wouldn’t keep it outside on windy day ..
customer_reviews.author: Diya

customer_reviews.title: This Clothes Drying Rack is REALLY GOOD!!
customer_reviews.text: This Clothes Drying Rack is really good! It is sturdy, holds a good amount of laundry and is better than I expected. I had it outside on the deck in considerable wind and it didn't blow over. The metal is "smooth" -- no rough edges. I am very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy. Excited to try it out soon
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used it yet, but I did take it out and set it up. It's exactly what I was looking for. Very sturdy. Excited to try it out soon.
customer_reviews.author: vik

customer_reviews.title: Beach Vacation Must Have
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to take on a beach vacation and it was FANTASTIC! For some reason, seaside motels don't seem to have anywhere to hang wet bathing suits and towels (we learned this the hard way). This year we took this rack w/us and it solved the problem. Sturdy and easy to move around. Someone on our trip loved it so much I bought her one as gift!
customer_reviews.author: Missy Bluth

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk!!
customer_reviews.text: The rods were constantly coming loose. It's the flimsiest stainless steel I've ever seen. Overall, I wasted my money on this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Norma J. Hanko

customer_reviews.title: As useful as it comes
customer_reviews.text: Works great and supports quite a bit of weight. I do wish it was a little bit longer but otherwise it’s great
customer_reviews.author: JACC015

customer_reviews.title: Just what we were looking for - we use this ...
customer_reviews.text: Just what we were looking for - we use this while we "glamp" in our RV - hang wet clothes outside to dry.
customer_reviews.author: Rickk

customer_reviews.title: small but very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This is smaller than what I expected. However it is very sturdy. It locks into place. You can load your clothes and pick up the drying rack to move it out of the way with all the clothes on it. I am ordering a second one to have on hand for large loads of line dry items.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey

customer_reviews.title: Easy for elderly parent to use
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my 92 year old arthritic mother. She was very pleased and says she can set it up and take it down easily.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanine Mathes

customer_reviews.title: Great product and good quality!
customer_reviews.text: Love this product! I finally have a way to air dry my sweaters, knit tops and tights. Very well made and folds away between my washer and dryer.
customer_reviews.author: Happyone

product_meta.title: STORAGE MANIAC Foldable Clothes Drying Rack, 3-Tier 41 Inch Height, Laundry Rack with Rustproof Coating, Silvery
feature_bullets: STURDY CONSTRUCTION AND LARGE DRYING SPACE: All-steel construction, saves energy and help clothes last longer; 11 steel drying rods offer 20 feet of drying space, size 22.44"x14.57"x41.34"
SUITABLE FOR THE CLOTHES THAT NEED TO LAY FLAT TO DRY: Features a top shelf for sweaters or other flat-drying items
RUST-RESISTANT: Waterproof and Eco-Friendly coating helps eliminate rust
EASY TO USE: Lightweight and easy to drop into position for use; Can be used indoors or outdoors
COLLAPSIBLE: Accordion design folds flat for compact storage easily
